books.title: Sartor Resartus
books.author: Thomas Carlyle
books.summary: The meta-fictional commentary on the life of “famous” German philosopher Diogenes Teufelsdröckh and his Philosophy of Clothes.

books.title: Jungle Tales of Tarzan
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A collection of short stories about Tarzan growing up in the jungle.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: The Princess and the Goblin
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: A princess and her young friend valiantly fend off a goblin attack with help from a ghostly relative.

books.title: Tartuffe
books.author: Molière
books.summary: A father announces his daughter will marry Tartuffe, a sanctimonious fraud and hypocrite.

books.title: King John
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King John is commanded to hand over his throne to Arthur of Bretagne or face war with the French.

books.title: The King of Elfland’s Daughter
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: The people of Erl want magic, and get their wish.

books.title: The Bridal Wreath
books.author: Sigrid Undset
books.summary: In 14th-century Norway, a nobleman’s daughter grows up and faces passion, sin, and filial piety.

books.title: The House on the Borderland
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: An account of the terrifying metaphysical haunting of a recluse’s secluded home.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: A collection of Henry David Thoreau’s essays.

books.title: Poirot Investigates
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A calculating Belgian detective and his wide-eyed companion investigate and solve a series of mysteries.

books.title: Scrambles Amongst the Alps in the Years 1860–69
books.author: Edward Whymper
books.summary: A classic in early mountaineering literature, describing the first ascent of the Matterhorn and other climbs in the Alps.

books.title: The Crowd
books.author: Gustave Le Bon
books.summary: Le Bon explores the psychology, motivations, and dangers of crowds of people.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A collection of Ambrose Bierce’s poetry.

books.title: Dodsworth
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: A newly-retired businessman’s peaceful European trip falls apart as his wife chases high European society.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: A collection of fantasy and science fiction short fiction by Andre Norton.

books.title: Ukridge Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of stories featuring P. G. Wodehouse’s charismatic character Stanley Featherstonehaugh Ukridge.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
